title: Evolution of my professional status
digitalNomadWhat: I do what I know: building websites or web applications for people. Except that I am my own boss, and I have to look for clients.
digitalNomadWhy: Now that I have experience, being freelance allows me to explore different technical solutions and to be able to travel if missions are full remote! #digitalNomad
frontPadamWhat: I worked in a big SAAS startup, inside a team with "agile" processes. I was maintaining a booking website for intelligent buses, with complex configurations.
frontPadamWhy: I learned to deliver features in the most measurable and stable way possible (Continuous Integration & Continuous Development). I also learned to work transversely with people from other departments.
mkmWhat: I joined a small FinTech startup that was building SAAS platforms and mobile apps for local currency organizations.
mkmWhy: I was able to experience innovation, flexible processes, and horizontal human relationships in this little company. It allowed me to explore several fields, from marketing to coding. I discovered that I really liked building web applications!
tptWhat: A complete formation on IT, project management, economy, entrepreneurship. I chose anthropology and philosophy as optional courses. Several student projects including video game, connected objects (IoT) and design
tptWhy: I've always admired Internet and Informatics. I chose the best engineer school in this field, and I was living in Paris intra-muros!
prepaWhat: Hard work. 12+ hours of Maths per week. Chess practicing. Logical reflection. Analyzing coherence of ideologies.
prepaWhy: I loved Maths (Litterature too, although). This was the "by default" step in order to candidate to the best high schools.
